intro: Heliocarpus belizensis, commonly known as the Belize hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Belize. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in vibrant colors such as red, yellow, and orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, and features rough, hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, a feature typical of the genus Heliocarpus.
